pullRequest.title: docs - add book info, content updates required to get the docs to build
pullRequest.bodyText:
this PR includes the book configuration and content updates required to build the open source pxf docs from the content added to this repository in #374.  in this PR:

add the book/ contents - the majority of the book was copied from the https://github.com/greenplum-db/gpdb/tree/master/gpdb-doc/book directory
added a README.md describing how to build the open source pxf docs
doc content files - replaced peer cross-references with full greenplum docs URL

note:  the pxf book uses bookbinder to build the pxf docs, just as the greenplum docs do.  bookbinder is a ruby build environment.  i plan to enhance the README, and possibly provide a Docker file that one could use to build the docs on a linux system in a separate PR.
doc review site link:  http://docs-lisa-pxf-oss.cfapps.io/pxf/WIP/overview_pxf.html

commit.message: docs - add book contents, landing page, docs build README
replace greenplum peer xrefs with complete URL

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            The Greenplum Database end user accesses an external data source by invoking a `CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE` command specifying the `pxf` protocol. (Refer to the [CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE](https://gpdb.docs.pivotal.io/latest/ref_guide/sql_commands/CREATE_EXTERNAL_TABLE.html) reference page in the Greenplum documentaion for more about this command.)
          
          
            
            The Greenplum Database end user accesses an external data source by invoking a `CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE` command specifying the `pxf` protocol. (Refer to the [CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE](https://gpdb.docs.pivotal.io/latest/ref_guide/sql_commands/CREATE_EXTERNAL_TABLE.html) reference page in the Greenplum documentation for more about this command.)
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -47,7 +47,7 @@ The administrator must also install any third-party commands or other components
 
 To verify that you deployed a connector successfully, you create a Greenplum Database external table and invoke `SELECT` and/or `INSERT` commands on the table to test read and write operations on the external data source.
 
-The Greenplum Database end user accesses an external data source by invoking a `CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE` command specifying the `pxf` protocol. (Refer to the [CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE](../../ref_guide/sql_commands/CREATE_EXTERNAL_TABLE.html) reference page for more about this Greenplum Database command.)
+The Greenplum Database end user accesses an external data source by invoking a `CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE` command specifying the `pxf` protocol. (Refer to the [CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE](https://gpdb.docs.pivotal.io/latest/ref_guide/sql_commands/CREATE_EXTERNAL_TABLE.html) reference page in the Greenplum documentaion for more about this command.)

nodes.bodyText: not sure why this line has Greenplum Database [CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE].. but in other places Greenplum Database was not added. Is this on purpose?
nodes.diffHunk:

 FORMAT 'CUSTOM|TEXT' (FORMATTER='pxfwritable_import' | delimiter='<delim>')
 ```

+Hive connector-specific keywords and values used in the Greenplum Database [CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE](https://gpdb.docs.pivotal.io/latest/ref_guide/sql_commands/CREATE_EXTERNAL_TABLE.html) call are described below.
 ```
